symurbench

Documentation

symurbench
  • symurbench 0.1 documentation

SyMuRBench documentation

Quick start

Installation

First, you should clone this repo

git clone https://github.com/Mintas/SyMuRBench.git

Then download datasets from huggingface

.

and put them into project root directory.

Running benchmark with precomputed features

Here is the exampe of running benchmark for 2 tasks: ComposerClassificationASAP and ScorePerformanceRetrievalASAP.

by default, if no tasks provided, benchmark runs all tasks

from symurbench.benchmark import Benchmark
from symurbench.feature_extractor import PersistentFeatureExtractor

path_to_music21_features = "data/features/music21_full_dataset.parquet"
path_to_jsymbolic_features = "data/features/jsymbolic_full_dataset.parquet"

m21_pfe = PersistentFeatureExtractor(
   persistence_path=path_to_music21_features,
   use_cached=True,
   name="music21"
)
jsymb_pfe = PersistentFeatureExtractor(
   persistence_path=path_to_jsymbolic_features,
   use_cached=True,
   name="jSymbolic"
)

benchmark = Benchmark(
   feature_extractors_list=[m21_pfe, js_pfe],
   tasks=[
      "ComposerClassificationASAP",
      "ScorePerformanceRetrievalASAP"
   ]
)

benchmark.run_all_tasks()
benchmark.display_result()

Running benchmark, calculating and writing features to file

from symurbench.benchmark import Benchmark
from symurbench.feature_extractor import PersistentFeatureExtractor
from symurbench.music21_extractor import Music21Extractor

path_to_music21_features = "data/features/music21_full_dataset.parquet"

m21_pfe = PersistentFeatureExtractor(
   feature_extractor=Music21Extractor(),
   persistence_path=path_to_music21_features,
   use_cached=False,
   name="music21"
)

benchmark = Benchmark(
   feature_extractors_list=[m21_pfe],
   tasks=[
      "ComposerClassificationASAP",
      "ScorePerformanceRetrievalASAP"
   ]
)

benchmark.run_all_tasks()
benchmark.display_result()

Running benchmark from config

from symurbench.benchmark import Benchmark
from symurbench.music21_extractor import Music21Extractor

config = {
   "ComposerClassificationASAP": {
      "metadata_csv_path":"data/datasets/composer_and_retrieval_datasets/metadata_composer_dataset.csv",
      "files_dir_path":"data/datasets/composer_and_retrieval_datasets/"
   }
}

m21_fe = Music21Extractor()

benchmark = Benchmark.init_from_config(
   feature_extractors_list=[m21_fe],
   tasks_config=config
)
benchmark.run_all_tasks()
benchmark.display_result()

Running benchmark from YAML file with config

from symurbench.benchmark import Benchmark
from symurbench.music21_extractor import Music21Extractor

config_path = "configs/tasks_config.yaml"

m21_fe = Music21Extractor()

benchmark = Benchmark.init_from_config_file(
   feature_extractors_list=[m21_fe],
   tasks_config_path=config_path
)
benchmark.run_all_tasks()
benchmark.display_result()

Saving pandas DataFrame with results

from symurbench.benchmark import Benchmark
from symurbench.music21_extractor import Music21Extractor

path_to_music21_features = "data/features/music21_full_dataset.parquet"

m21_pfe = PersistentFeatureExtractor(
   feature_extractor=Music21Extractor(),
   persistence_path=path_to_music21_features,
   use_cached=False,
   name="music21"
)

benchmark = Benchmark.init_from_config_file(
   feature_extractors_list=[m21_pfe]
)
benchmark.run_all_tasks()
benchmark.get_result_df(round_num=3, add_std=True).to_csv("result.csv")

Contents

symurbench

symurbench package
Subpackages
symurbench.abstract_tasks package
Submodules
symurbench.abstract_tasks.abstask module

Implementation of an Abstract Base Class for tasks.

class symurbench.abstract_tasks.abstask.AbsTask

Bases: ABC

Abstract Base Class for tasks.

This class provides an API interface for implementing tasks.

Users can create their own subclass and implement the following methods: - calculate_metrics method to calculate metrics for features (and labels). - ‘run` method to extract features and calculate metrics for them.

Parameters:

  • metadata (BaseMetaLoader) – BaseMetaLoader instance with metadata

  • name (str) – name of the task

  • description (str) – description of the task

abstract calculate_metrics(data: DataFrame) → list[MetricValue]

Calculate metrics for extracted features.

Parameters:

data (pd.DataFrame) – dataframe with features and labels (or only with features) For classification tasks, target columns should be predefined in AutoML config.

Returns:

List of MetricValue objects (for each calculated metric).

Each object has an unique name.

Return type:

list[MetricValue]

description: str = ''
metadata: BaseMetaLoader
name: str
classmethod pass_args(metadata_csv_path: str | None = None, files_dir_path: str | None = None, dataset_filter_list: list[str] | None = None, **kwargs) → None

Pass arguments for metadata or for __init__.

Parameters:

  • metadata_csv_path (str, optional) – BaseMetaLoader parameter, absolute path to CSV file with metadata (filenames, class labels). Defaults to None.

  • files_dir_path (str, optional) – BaseMetaLoader parameter, absolute path to folder with MIDI files. Defaults to None.

  • dataset_filter_list (list[str] | None, optional) – BaseMetaLoader parameter, list with files for inclusion filtering (optional). Defaults to None.

  • **kwargs (dict) – dict with __init__ method arguments

run(feature_extractor: FeatureExtractor | PersistentFeatureExtractor) → list[MetricValue]

Launch task for provided feature extractor.

Parameters:

feature_extractor (FeatureExtractor | PersistentFeatureExtractor) – FeatureExtractor or PersistentFeatureExtractor object

Returns:

List of MetricValue objects (for each calculated metric).

Each object should have an unique name.

Return type:

list[MetricValue]

Base class for classification tasks.

class symurbench.abstract_tasks.classification_task.ClassificationTask(automl_config_path: str, scorer: BaseScorer)

Bases: AbsTask

A class for evaluating FeatureExtractor on a classification task.

calculate_metrics(data: DataFrame, preprocess_features: bool) → list[MetricValue]

Run AutoML and calculate metrics for predictions.

Parameters:

  • data (pd.DataFrame) – dataframe with features and labels (or only with features)

  • preprocess_features (bool) – whether to preprocess features. If True, preprocess features according to automl config. If False, use features as they are.

Returns:

List of MetricValue objects (for each calculated metric).

Each object has an unique name.

Return type:

list[MetricValue]

init_automl(preprocess_features: bool) → tuple[AutoML, dict, int]

Initialize automl model.

Parameters:

preprocess_features (bool) – whether to preprocess features. If True, preprocess features according to automl config. If False, use features as they are.

Raises:

ValueError – if config at self.automl_config_path is None

Returns:

AutoML object, dict with roles, verbose parameter

Return type:

tuple[AutoML, dict, int]

feature_extractor (FeatureExtractor | PersistentFeatureExtractor) – FeatureExtractor or PersistentFeatureExtractor object

Returns:

Each object should have unique name.

Base class for retrieval tasks.

class symurbench.abstract_tasks.retrieval_task.RetrievalTask(scorer: BaseScorer, postfixes: tuple[str, str] = ('sp', 'ps'))

Bases: AbsTask

A class for evaluating FeatureExtractor on a retrieval task.

calculate_metrics(data: DataFrame) → list[MetricValue]

Calculate metrics for features.

Parameters:

data (pd.DataFrame) – dataframe with features

Raises:

ValueError – if data.shape[0] is not an even number

Returns:

List of MetricValue objects (for each calculated metric). Each object has an unique name.

Return type:

list[MetricValue]

calculate_metrics_one_direction(features_1: ndarray, features_2: ndarray, postfix: str = '') → list[MetricValue]

Calculate retrieval metrics for pair of embedding matrices.

Parameters:

  • features_1 (np.ndarray, float or int) – matrix 1 of shape (n_embeddings, embedding_size)

  • features_2 (np.ndarray, float or int) – matrix 2 of shape (n_embeddings, embedding_size)

  • postfix (str, optional) – postfix to add to metric name. Defaults to “”.

Returns:

Calculated retrieval metrics.

Return type:

list[MetricValue]

Abstract base class for metadata dataset loading.

Parameters:

  • files_dir_path (str) – absolute path to folder with MIDI files

  • dataset_filter_list (list[str] | None, optional) – list with files for inclusion filtering (optional). Defaults to None.

abstract get_filenames(df: DataFrame) → list[str]

Load filenames from pd.DataFrame with metadata.

Can load files from multiple columns if needed.

Parameters:

df (pd.DataFrame) – pd.DataFrame with metadata

Returns:

filelist from file_columns.

The order of the files is important: files from each column should not be shuffled either inside the column or between the columns.

Return type:

list[str]

symurbench.metrics.metric_value module

Implementation of a container class for calculated metrics.

class symurbench.metrics.metric_value.MetricValue(name: str, values: list[float | int], aggregate: str = 'mean')

Bases: object

Container for calculated metrics.

get_agg_value(round_num: int = 2, add_std: bool = False) → float | int | str

Return rounded aggregated value.

Unites 2 methods: _get_agg_value and _get_agg_std_as_str.

Parameters:

  • round_num (int, optional) – The number of decimals to use when rounding aggregated and std values. Defaults to 3.

  • add_std (bool, optional) – If True, std values are added to aggregated values. In that case function returns str object. Float or int otherwise. Defaults to False.

Returns:

Aggregated values with/without std.

Return type:

float|int|str

property is_single_value: bool

Check number of elements in self.values.

Returns:

True if self.values length equals 1, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

property name: str

Name.

validate() → None

Validate name, values and aggregation_type.

Raises:

  • TypeError – if self._name is not a string

  • TypeError – if self._values is not a list / an empty list

  • TypeError – if self._values contains data types other than int and float

  • ValueError – if self.aggregation_type not in (“mean”, “median”)

property values: list[float | int]

Raw values.

symurbench.metrics.scorer module

Base class for metrics calculation.

class symurbench.metrics.scorer.BaseScorer

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for calculating classification metrics.

Subclasses must implement the calculate_metrics method.

abstract calculate_metrics(y_true: list | ndarray, preds: list | ndarray) → list[MetricValue]

Calculate metrics for the task.

Parameters:

  • y_true (list | np.ndarray) – list or np.array with true values (e.g. class indices). Floats or integers.

  • preds (list | np.ndarray) – list or np.array with predicted values. (e.g. probabilities). Floats or integers.

Raises:

NotImplementedError –

Returns:

List of MetricValue objects (for each calculated metric).

Each object should have unique name.

Return type:

list[MetricValue]

symurbench.benchmark module

Benchmark class implementtion.

class symurbench.benchmark.Benchmark(feature_extractors_list: list[FeatureExtractor | PersistentFeatureExtractor], tasks: list[str] | list[AbsTask] | None = None)

Bases: object

Class for benchmarking different feature extractors.

display_result(round_num: int = 2, add_std: bool = False, colored: bool = True) → None

Display dataframe with calculated metrics in HTML format.

Parameters:

  • round_num (int, optional) – The number of decimals to use when rounding the number. Defaults to 2.

  • add_std (bool, optional) – If True, std values are added to aggregated classification metrics. Defaults to False.

  • colored (bool, optional) – If True, highlight the best values with green color and the worst values with red color. Defaults to True.

get_result_df(round_num: int = 2, add_std: bool = False) → DataFrame

Aggregate self.metrics into a pandas.DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • round_num (int, optional) – The number of decimals to use when rounding the number. Defaults to 2.

  • add_std (bool, optional) – If True, std values are added to aggregated classification metrics. Defaults to False.

Returns:

pd.DataFrame with calculated metrics

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

get_result_dict(round_num: int = 2, add_std: bool = False) → dict

Aggregate self.metrics into a human-readable dict.

Parameters:

  • round_num (int, optional) – The number of decimals to use when rounding the number. Defaults to 2.

  • add_std (bool, optional) – If True, std values are added to aggregated classification metrics. Defaults to False.

Returns:

dict with the following structure:

{“task name”: {“feature extractor name”: {“metric name”: metric value} }}

Return type:

dict

classmethod get_tasks(task_names: list[str] | None, init_tasks: bool = True) → list[ClassificationTask | RetrievalTask]

Load and initialize tasks.

Parameters:

  • task_names (list[str] | None) – list of tasks names to load

  • init_tasks (bool, optional) – flag, if True, function returns list of objects, if False, function returns list of classes. Defaults to True.

Returns:

list of task objects or list of task classes

Return type:

list[ClassificationTask | RetrievalTask]

classmethod init_from_config(feature_extractors_list: list[FeatureExtractor | PersistentFeatureExtractor], tasks_config: dict) → None

Initialize benchmark from config.

Parameters:

  • feature_extractors_list (list[FeatureExtractor|PersistentFeatureExtractor]) – list with FeatureExtractor and/or PersistentFeatureExtractor objects to compare

  • tasks_config (dict) –

    dict with config. Config has the following structure: 1) key - task name; 2) value - dict with arguments for task name.

    Config arguments include: 1) arguments for MetaLoader; 2) arguments for __init__() method of the class

    Example of config can be found in configs/tasks_config.yaml

Returns:

Benchmark class instance object

classmethod init_from_config_file(feature_extractors_list: list[FeatureExtractor | PersistentFeatureExtractor], tasks_config_path: str) → None

Initialize benchmark from YAML config file.

Parameters:

  • feature_extractors_list (list[FeatureExtractor|PersistentFeatureExtractor]) – list with FeatureExtractor and/or PersistentFeatureExtractor objects to compare

  • tasks_config_path (str) –

    path to YAML file with config. Config has the following structure: 1) key - task name; 2) value - dict with arguments for task name.

    Config arguments include: 1) arguments for MetaLoader; 2) arguments for __init__() method of the class

    Example of config can be found in configs/tasks_config.yaml

Raises:

ValueError – if config is empty

symurbench.feature_extractor module

Abstract Base Class for feature extraction implemetation.

class symurbench.feature_extractor.FeatureExtractor(extractor_name: str, fast: bool = False, preprocess_features: bool = True)

Bases: ABC

Abstract Base Class for feature extraction from a list of files.

This class provides an API interface for implementing feature extraction functions. The result of this would be the desired vector representation or embedding to be tested in the underlying benchmark.

Users can create their own subclass and implement the extract_features_from_file method to extract features from a file.

Users can also override the extract_features_from_files method to extract features from files in batches rather than one at a time.

abstract extract_features_from_file(file_path: str) → ndarray

Extract features from a file.

Parameters:

file_path (str) – absolute path to MIDI file. (or any other extension for symbolic music if datasets are converted to the desired format).

Returns:

numpy array with shape (n_features,) with extracted features

Return type:

np.ndarray

extract_features_from_files(file_paths: list[str]) → DataFrame

Extract features from a list of files.

The order of the files is crucial. The extracted features should be placed in the same order as the input files.

Parameters:

  • file_paths (list[str]) – list of absolute paths to MIDI files

  • music ((or any other extension for symbolic)

  • format). (if datasets are converted to the desired)

Raises:

  • ValueError – if the extracted features matrix has shape len less than 2.

  • ValueError – if features.shape[0] != len(file_paths)

Returns:

pandas.DataFrame with extracted features; Shape: (len(file_paths), n_features); DataFrame do not contain header or index column

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

get_features_with_labels(task_name: str, meta_dataset: MetaDataset) → DataFrame

Create DataFrame with features and labels for the task with name task_name.

Parameters:

  • task_name (str) – name of the task. (All tasks listed in tasks folder)

  • meta_dataset (MetaDataset) – MetaDataset object. Contains: 1) absolute paths to .mid files; 2) Filenames; 3) labels (optional)

Returns:

DataFrame with embeddings and labels

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

class symurbench.feature_extractor.PersistentFeatureExtractor(feature_extractor: FeatureExtractor | None = None, persistence_path: str = '', use_cached: bool = False, overwrite_features: bool = False, name: str = 'feature extractor', preprocess_features: bool = True)

Bases: object

A class that extends FeatureExtractor.

Provides methods for writing and loading extracted features at the file system level (using parquet files).

It also includes a fallback mechanism that delegates management to the FeatureExtractor class.

Fallback to FeatureExtractor occurs in the following cases: - No “persistence_path” provided - “use_cached” is False - “use_cached” is True, but no features are found in the parquet file at the specified “persistence_path”

filter_features(df: DataFrame, files_to_keep: list[str]) → DataFrame

Filter features and check their order using an inclusion list of files.

load_features_from_pqt(pqt_path: str, task_name: str, filelist: list[str]) → DataFrame

Load features from a parquet file.

Parameters:

  • pqt_path (str) – path to parquet file. Parquet file should contain: 1) feature vectors in rows - [int or float] 2) column “midi_file” with corresponding file names - [str] 3) column “task” with corresponding task name - [str] (if parquet contains features for one task only, column “task” is not neccesary)

  • task_name (str) – name of the task

  • filelist (list[str]) – list of filenames from task dataset

Raises:

ValueError – if pqt_path does not exist

Returns:

DataFrame with loaded features

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

validate_writing(df: DataFrame, existing_df: DataFrame, task_name: str) → None

Validate existing_df for writing features.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame with features to save

  • existing_df (pd.DataFrame) – existing DataFrame with features

  • task_name (str) – name of the task

Raises:

  • ValueError – if there are no ‘task’ or ‘midi_file’ columns in existing_df

  • ValueError – if existing_df contain features for current task and self.overwrite_features is False

  • ValueError – if existing_df.shape[1] != df.shape[1]

write_features_to_pqt(pqt_path: str, task_name: str, filelist: list[str], features: DataFrame) → None

Write calculated features to a parquet file.

Parameters:

  • pqt_path (str) –

    path to parquet. Parquet will contain: Feature vectors in rows - [int or float] 1) column “midi_file” with corresponding file names - [str] 2) column “task” with corresponding task name - [str] separator = “,” .. rubric:: Example

    |E_0|E_1|E_2|midi_file|task | ________________________________ | 0 |0.1|1.1|file1.mid|genre | | 1 |3.8|4.0|file2.mid|genre | | 0 |1.1|4.8|file3.mid|composer| | 0 |4.5|7.6|file4.mid|composer|

  • task_name (str) – name of the task

  • filelist (list[str]) – list of filenames from task dataset

  • features (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame with extracted features

symurbench.utils module

Utilities.

symurbench.utils.display_styler(df: DataFrame, round_num: int = 2, std: bool = False, colored: bool = True) → Styler

Display Styler object.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame with metrics to display

  • round_num (int) – The number of decimals to use when rounding the number. Defaults to 2.

  • std (bool, optional) – If True, cell values are considered as strings in format 0.05 ± 0.01, else cell values are considered as floats. Defaults to False.

  • colored (bool) – flag responsible for highlighting the Best/Worst metrics. Defaults to True.
